Get a path in the reciprocal space

calculate_special_k() → None[source]
get_path(fractional_k_names: list[str], n_split: int) → PathValues[source]

Calculates a path through specified special points in the Brillouin zone.

Parameters:

  • fractional_k_names (list[str]) – List of special point names to form the path.

  • n_split (int) – Number of points between each special point.

Returns:

Values with path.

Return type:

k_path (PathValue)

get_reciprocal_vectors(n_g: int) → ndarray[source]

Generate the reciprocal lattice vectors used to define the Brillouin zone boundaries.

Parameters:

n_g – Number of reciprocal lattice vectors

Returns:

A numpy array of reciprocal lattice vectors.

Return type:

np.ndarray

static split_fractional_k_name(fractional_k_name: str) → tuple[source]

Split fractional special k points.

Parameters:

fractional_k_name (str) – A string of fractional special k points

Raises:

ValueError – If the string format is invalid.

Returns:

fraction and the name of a special k point.

Return type:

tuple

class elphem.lattice.rotation.LatticeRotation2D[source]

Bases: LatticeRotation

Provides methods to optimize and adjust 2D lattice orientations through rotation operations.

classmethod calculate_optimized_basis(basis: ndarray, axis: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Optimize the rotation of the given basis to align with the specified axis.

Parameters:

  • basis (np.ndarray) – The basis vectors of the lattice to be rotated.

  • axis (np.ndarray) – The target axis for alignment.

Returns:

The optimized basis vectors aligned as closely as possible to the target axis.

Return type:

np.ndarray

Raises:

ValueError – If the axis vector is zero.

classmethod search_optimized_direction(basis: ndarray, axis: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

search_optimized_direction the given basis direction to the specified axis using quaternion rotation.

Parameters:

  • basis (np.ndarray) – The initial basis vectors.

  • axis (np.ndarray) – The axis to align the basis vectors to.

Returns:

The basis vectors rotated to search_optimized_direction the direction of the axis.

Return type:

np.ndarray

Raises:

ValueError – If the axis vector is zero.

class elphem.lattice.rotation.LatticeRotation3D[source]

Bases: LatticeRotation

Provides methods to optimize and adjust 3D lattice orientations through rotation operations.

classmethod calculate_optimized_basis(basis: ndarray, axis: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Optimize the rotation of the given basis to align with the specified axis.

Parameters:

  • basis (np.ndarray) – The basis vectors of the lattice to be rotated.

  • axis (np.ndarray) – The target axis for alignment.

Returns:

The optimized basis vectors aligned as closely as possible to the target axis.

Return type:

np.ndarray

Raises:

ValueError – If the axis vector is zero.

classmethod rotate_vector_around_axis(axis: ndarray, v: ndarray, theta: float) → ndarray[source]

Rotate vector v around the given axis by angle theta.

Parameters:

  • axis (np.ndarray) – The axis of rotation.

  • v (np.ndarray) – The vector to rotate.

  • theta (float) – The angle in radians to rotate the vector.

Returns:

The rotated vector.

Return type:

np.ndarray

Raises:

ValueError – If the axis vector is zero.

classmethod search_optimized_direction(basis: ndarray, axis: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

search_optimized_direction the given basis direction to the specified axis using quaternion rotation.

Parameters:

  • basis (np.ndarray) – The initial basis vectors.

  • axis (np.ndarray) – The axis to align the basis vectors to.

Returns:

The basis vectors rotated to search_optimized_direction the direction of the axis.

Return type:

np.ndarray

Raises:

ValueError – If the axis vector is zero.

classmethod search_optimized_posture(basis: ndarray, axis: ndarray, angle_max: float = 360.0) → ndarray[source]

Search for the best posture of the basis aligned with the given axis.

Parameters:

  • basis (np.ndarray) – The basis to be rotated.

  • axis (np.ndarray) – The axis to align with.

  • angle_max (float) – The maximum angle range to search in degrees.

Returns:

The optimally aligned basis after posture search.

Return type:

np.ndarray

Raises:

ValueError – If the axis vector is zero.
